elena_enters.speaker: Narrator
elena_enters.text: A woman enters your cafe, her posture rigid, her eyes scanning the room with guarded wariness. She carries herself like someone expecting disappointment.

elena_first_words.speaker: Elena
elena_first_words.text: *She approaches the counter, her voice clipped and formal* I was told this establishment is... discreet. That one can find a quiet corner without questions.

choices.text: Everyone's welcome here. No questions, just good food.
You seem troubled. Would you like to talk about it?

elena_relaxes.speaker: Elena
elena_relaxes.text: *Her shoulders drop slightly* That's... refreshing. Most places want to know everything. Your business, your family, your story. *She pauses* I just need somewhere to think.

elena_defensive.speaker: Elena
elena_defensive.text: *Her walls go back up instantly* I didn't come here for counseling. *She takes a breath* I apologize. That was... uncalled for. I just need somewhere to think.

elena_sits.speaker: Narrator
elena_sits.text: She chooses a corner table, her back to the wall where she can watch the door. Your dragon approaches curiously, and for the first time, her expression softens.

elena_dragon.speaker: Elena
elena_dragon.text: *She reaches out tentatively to touch your dragon* We had a family dragon once. Before... *She stops herself* It doesn't matter. Some things can't be fixed.

dragon_comfort.speaker: Narrator
dragon_comfort.text: Your dragon nuzzles against her hand, sensing something underneath her proud exterior - a loneliness she tries hard to hide.

elena_surprised.speaker: Elena
elena_surprised.text: *Her voice catches slightly* Your dragon has gentle manners. It's been so long since... *She clears her throat* I'm Elena. I may become a regular here, if that's acceptable.

player_accept.speaker: You
player_accept.text: You're always welcome here, Elena. The corner booth will be yours whenever you need it.

elena_grateful.speaker: Elena
elena_grateful.text: *A flicker of something like gratitude crosses her face* Thank you. You may come to regret that offer when you learn what kind of mess follows me. But for now... thank you.
